channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Farthing still working to rescue terrified staff
item.description: The former Royal Marine who flew animals over from Afghanistan says he will not give up on staff.

item.title: Dying Gateshead woman's letters urge family to probe cancer delay
item.description: Sheila Brown died after her cancer spread having written "things like this should not happen".

item.title: Milton Keynes lake rescue: Mum tracks down pair who saved son
item.description: Her seven-year-old fell into a lake and was rescued by strangers who she says "saved his life".

item.title: Driffield mural divides opinion over lack of diversity
item.description: The council says it was designed to attract people to Driffield, not generate negative publicity.

item.title: Ex-boss of Bridgerton estate in court charged with sex offences
item.description: Simon Howard is accused of attacking a woman at Castle Howard in North Yorkshire in 2003 and 2004.

item.title: RSPCA rescue kitten found in car engine after trip from Wales to Leeds
item.description: Tom the six-week-old kitten is lucky not to have been badly injured says the RSPCA.

item.title: Amputee gets blue badge after 'leg will not re-grow' letter
item.description: Amputee Ben Perry says his doctor is a "legend" for writing to a council to support his appeal.

item.title: M25: Fourth person dies after lorry, minibus and car crash
item.description: Lisa Gardiner and three other minibus passengers were killed in a crash with a lorry and car.

item.title: Murder arrest after father dies on Birmingham night out
item.description: Matthew Carroll was with his son and some of his friends in Birmingham city centre.

item.title: Isle of Wight sea eagles: 12 more birds of prey released
item.description: The 12 young white-tailed eagles are the latest to be released as part of an on-going project.

item.title: Pocklington rugby player's feet too big for his boots
item.description: Two-metre tall Oliver, 17, is unable to find a replacement pair after outgrowing his size 15 studs.

item.title: 'Wheelyboat gives me freedom out on the water'
item.description: A specially designed boat with wheelchair access is allowing disabled anglers to go fishing.

item.title: Covid shielder gets private opera performance in back garden
item.description: Ceinwen Giles is shielding from Covid due to her cancer treatment, so an opera was brought to her garden.

item.title: Mental Health: The ambulance workers feeding callers
item.description: A Merseyside mental health ambulance team is offering food support for its most in need patients.

item.title: Family of ducks waddles through University of Nottingham library
item.description: The mother and her ducklings were "calm and unflustered" as they walked around George Green Library.

item.title: Childcare costs: London parents call for review
item.description: Childcare costs are 30% higher in inner London than the national average, a study found.

item.title: Tameside tram crash: Cyclist, 10, suffers serious head injuries
item.description: The boy was taken to hospital by air ambulance with "life-threatening injuries", police say.

item.title: Frome Town FC's win-a-car draw halted after thousands of free entries
item.description: Frome Town FC say one man entered its charity draw for free 2,001 times, with the club losing money.

item.title: Premier League clubs could be banned from picking players not released for internationals
item.description: Premier League clubs could be stopped from picking players for their next game after refusing to release them for World Cup qualifiers.

item.title: WSL 2021-22: How can you follow coverage on the BBC?
item.description: The BBC will broadcast the first-ever domestic women's game on network television this season.

item.title: Gareth Southgate says England must look at themselves before judging other countries' behaviour
item.description: Gareth Southgate says England should "get its own house in order" before criticising others for their behaviour.
